text: this raw crunchy delightful salad
features one of my favorite all-time
ingredients the sunchoke so the sunchoke
is a root vegetable that tastes quite a
bit like a water chestnut has a little
bit of a sweetness rich in fiber really
nice flavor sometimes you'll see these
guys really big sort of like potatoes
other times you'll see them more like a
fingerling potato peel away the skin and
then thinly slice it these are also
sometimes referred to as Jerusalem
artichokes and a mandolin is a great
tool to use not just for these guys but
for this entire salad everything's gonna
be very thinly sliced so the sunchoke
has a really nice fresh crispy texture
now to keep it nice and crisp I'm gonna
add it to a bowl of cold water this is
also gonna help keep it from oxidizing
now in addition to the water I'm gonna
add a little bit of lemon juice which
will add a really nice flavor and again
help prevent oxidation about a
tablespoon here now let's get started on
the Apple again a nice crunchy flavor so
start by peeling them down I usually
feel it whole but this works so quarter
the Apple and then thinly slice this as
well so the Apple here is again adding
really nice fresh crispy texture also a
great source of vitamin C and fiber
we're going to add this to the water as
well so it doesn't discolor and then to
that I have one head of fennel that our
Finley slice
and four stalks of thinly sliced celery
very crunchy salad so trace for this to
the refrigerator until all the
vegetables are nice and crispy and
chilled about 10 minutes vegetables are
nice and crisp and chilled let's work on
the dressing so I'm shooting it for
about two tablespoons of lemon juice to
that add two tablespoons of Dijon
mustard this dressing is one of my
favorites such a nice spicy flavor now
to mellow out the Dijon add about two
teaspoons of honey or to taste thinly
great one clove of garlic on a
microplane you could also really finely
chop this if your finely chopping it I
always like to mash it with a little bit
of coarse salt on the side of a chef's
knife that just helps really make it
nice and minced make sure you get it all
out here add a little bit of salt add a
little bit of pepper and then gradually
whisk in about six tablespoons of olive
oil
by adding the oil at a slow steady
stream i'm emulsifying the entire
dressing which is going to make it
really rich and creamy
definitely a main course worthy salad
nice and emulsified so I've blotted all
of my vegetables to dry with paper
towels really important you don't want
them to be too wet so transfer these to
your big mixing bowl to this add half a
cup of toasted chopped walnuts
now season the mixture pepper a little
bit salt and now let's dress gorgeous
toss it together you want to make sure
that everything is generously coated
well tossed so that all bites are
equally delicious this looks so crunchy
so fresh we'll garnish with some
reserved fennel fronds
this adds a really nice color to an
already beautiful salad let's give it a
try
mmm this is the perfect crispy crunchy
raw salad four fault
